required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary Salt During Pregnancy and Maternal Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Dietary Salt Intake During Pregnancy on Maternal Systemic and Uteroplacental Vascular Function

lead_sponsor.agency: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

clinical_study.source: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this study is to investigate the association of dietary salt intake during pregnancy with systemic micro- and macrovascular reactivity and uteroplacental vascular function of the mother, and to examine the potential impact of elevated oxidative stress on this association. Also, the aim is to investigate whether there is an association between excessive salt intake during pregnancy and the outcome of pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock:
During the study pregnant women at the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy) will have one study visit during which following procedures will be done:
- measurement of maternal systemic microvascular function by Laser Doppler flowmetry (post-occlusive reactive hyperemia, iontophoresis of acetylcholine and sodium nitroprusside)
- measurement of maternal systemic macrovascular function by vascular ultrasound measurement of brachial artery flow mediated dilation (FMD)
- measurement of maternal uteroplacental function by ultrasound color Doppler measurement of umbilical artery and fetal middle cerebral artery blood flow
- venous blood sampling; serum will be stored for measurement of oxidative stress, matrix metalloproteinase 9 and endocan level
- 24-hour urine natriuresis (to estimate daily salt intake)
- measurement of blood pressure, heart rate, height and weight, body composition
Immediately after the childbirth following procedures will be done:
- assessment of pregnancy outcome (duration of pregnancy, child birth weight, child birth length and Apgar score)
- placental tissue will be taken and stored for measurement of matrix metalloproteinase 9

primary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
primary_outcome.description: Skin microvascular reactivity assessed by Laser Doppler flowmetry (post-occlusive reactive hyperemia, iontophoresis of acetylcholine and sodium nitroprusside) - measured in perfusion units (PU)

primary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
primary_outcome.description: Vascular ultrasound measurement of brachial artery flow mediated dilation (FMD)

primary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
primary_outcome.description: Ultrasound color Doppler measurement of umbilical artery and fetal middle cerebral artery blood flow

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxidative stress - thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of biomarkers of oxidative stress level. Thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) - biomarker of lipid peroxidation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy) (serum) and immediately after childbirth (placental tissue sample)
secondary_outcome.description: ELISA measurement of serum matrix metalloproteinase 9 level in mother serum and placental tissue sample (taken after childbirth)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
secondary_outcome.description: ELISA measurement of serum endocan level - proteoglycan associated with endothelium activation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the outcome measure will be assessed at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
at one time point immediately after childbirth
at one time point immediately after childbirth
at one time point immediately after childbirth
secondary_outcome.description: Apgar score (in Apgar score scale, a total score of 1 to 10; the higher the score, the better the baby is doing after birth)

other_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
other_outcome.description: Automatic oscillometric measurement of systolic and diastolic blood pressure (in mmHg)

other_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
other_outcome.description: Automatic oscillometric measurement of heart rate (bpm)

other_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
other_outcome.description: Body composition and body fluid status measurement by a four-terminal portable impedance analyzer. Based on the value of skin resistance (Ohm) empirically derived formulas (the original manufacturer's software) will be used to calculate the estimated Fat Free Mass (FFM kg) and Fat (Fat Mass kg).

other_outcome.time_frame: at one time point in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
other_outcome.description: Body fluid status measurement by a four-terminal portable impedance analyzer. Based on the value of skin resistance (Ohm) empirically derived formulas (the original manufacturer's software) will be used to calculate the estimated Total Body Water (TBW L), Extracellular Water (ECW L), Intracellular Water (ICW L), Plasma Fluid (PF L) and Interstitial Fluid (IF L).

arm_group.description: intake of < 5 g of salt per day
intake of 5 - 7.5 g of salt per day
intake of 7.5 - 10 g of salt per day
intake of > 10 g of salt per day

study_pop.textblock: healthy pregnant women in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy pregnant women in the third trimester of pregnancy (37-38 weeks of pregnancy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- smoking
- prenatal hypertension
- thrombophilia
- low molecular weight heparin use
- coronary heart disease
- preconception diabetes
- gestational diabetes
- renal impairment
- cerebrovascular and peripheral artery disease
- any other preconception disease that could affect vascular and endothelial function

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek
responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Department of Physiology and Immunology Faculty of Medicine Osijek
